== Moral Vocabulary and Concepts==
−
'[[Conscience]]' refers to dispositions to behave in accordance with morality particularly in the face of [[temptation]].
+
  +
Morality can be considered a key component of [[folk psychology]], the set of intuitions and assumptions which governs our understanding of the social world, and our place within it as [[responsible]] agents with intentions, desires, beliefs etc. Very young children, and people suffering from severe mental illnesses and disabilities are not normally considered to be morally responsible. These cases aside, lapses of morality are said to [[deserve]][[condemnation]].
